CatDescriptText: Mr. William Otterson, salesman, Brighton Heights and Mr. Edward Scott, mail handler, Wilkinsburg, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in the Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, September 30, 1961, pg. 7 with question: "Do you think the United States should go to war with Russia over Berlin?"  Mr. Otteron's answer reads: "If we go to war with Russia, it won't be over Berlin and Berlin alone, but rather because this will be the straw which breaks the camel's back."  Mr. Scott's answer reads: " I don't think we should.  There should be more peaceful methods.  I don't think that Khrushchev is a maniac like Hitler, but rather realizes that a a World War would wipe out many of his people as well as ours."
TitMainTitle: Two frames: Portrait of William Otterson wearing gabardine suit jacket, striped necktie with clip, and eyeglasses, standing in front of buildings; Portrait of Edward Scott wearing button down uniform shirt with Alcoa Building patch, standing with hands on hips in front of ribbed metal column
